context: While antibiotics are beneficial in certain types of acute diarrhea, <a0_0><b6_0>they are usually not used except in specific situations<b6_0/><a0_0/>. There are concerns that antibiotics <a1_0><b4_0>may increase the risk of hemolytic uremic syndrome in people infected with Escherichia coli O157:H7<b4_0/><a1_0/>. <b5_0>In resource-poor countries<b5_0/>, treatment with antibiotics may be beneficial. However, <a2_0><b3_0>some bacteria are developing antibiotic resistance<b3_0/><a2_0/>, particularly <b7_0>Shigella<b7_0/>. Antibiotics can also cause diarrhea, and antibiotic-associated diarrhea is the most common adverse effect of treatment with general antibiotics.
